title: Police: 3-year-old girl dies in self-inflicted accident involving firearm
content:
Autoplay:XPolice: 3-year-old girl dies of firearm injury after incident in Kansas City, Mo.
KANSAS CITY, Mo. - UPDATE July 16, 3:03 p.m.: Police said Thursday the July 15 death of a 3-year-old girl "appears to be a self-inflicted, accidental shooting."
The report said the investigation is ongoing, and that the Jackson County Medical Examiner would release the final determination.
ORIGINAL STORY: Kansas City police said a 3-year-old girl has died after an incident involving a firearm in Kansas City, Mo.
Kansas City Police Department Chief Darryl Forte said the young girl was injured by a firearm near the 3100 block of Spruce, but did not say how she sustained the injury.
.@kcpolice 3 yr old injured by firearm -3100 blk of Spruce. Investigation on-going.
— chiefforte (@ChiefForte) July 16, 2015
Police confirmed on the scene that the girl had died from her injuries.
Ledrue Williams, a relative of the deceased, told 41 Action News he believes the incident was an accident.
"Only way I could have seen it happen was it was an accident," he said. "You know, that's the only thing I could see. I don't think, I don't believe nobody did it on purpose. I believe it's an accident."
The investigation is ongoing. Police said there were no suspects at large and that the shooting was not a drive-by.
